definition.@value: Late effects of non-traumatic subarachnoid haemorrhage 1 month or later after the onset of the disease. Codes for acute haemorrhage should be exclusively used for the acute haemorrhage and immediately related hospitalisation episodes.

codingNote.@value:
Use of the code ”Late effects of cerebrovascular disease” requires that there are residual (still persisting) symptoms or signs after a previous cerebrovascular event. Codes for neurological symptoms may be added. 

Code first, the specific residual condition(s) resulting from a previous cerebrovascular event. 

Codes for acute stroke should be exclusively used for the acute stroke and immediately related hospitalisation episodes.
